Simply for financial reasons =)!

Nichoel

----- Original Message -----
From: SandraDodd@...
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, January 28, 2002 2:00 PM
Subject: Re: Jamie Oliver was Why, oh why have the TV? Please passionate advocates of the TV, say something! [AlwaysLearning] TV, Video and unschooling



In a message dated 1/28/02 1:47:45 PM, stormyrain73@... writes:

<< Once every other month we are going to experiment with different types of
foods, I think Japanese will be our first since it's our 'inspiration'..we're
still working out the details but we will either be attempting to cook a
traditional meal or finding a restaurant and experiencing a traditional meal
:grin:.. >>

That's a long time to wait until the next experimental moment!
Why the time span? Seems very... structured. Artificial.

I'm truly curious about why the plan would be "once every other month" for
unschoolers.

Sandra

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/28/02 3:39:01 PM, ElissaJC@... writes:

<< My husband was wondering if he was gay. I said, No, He's just British. >>

If he is it'll be a surprise to his wife ;-)

A show or two before that he was discussing his honeymoon in Tuscany.

Sharon

IRON CHEF would come in my top 10.
Emily wants to know why that guy is so weird and why does he eat bell
peppers without chewing.
Elissa, who will soon be singing
Yippee - Kai - Yay!

>HAH, Naked chef is *ok* but IRON CHEF rules all..
>
>We are fully addicted to that show, every once of us races to the tv when
it's one so we can guess what 'new' ingredient will be unveiled and how the
chefs will prepare them..Then we try and fathom what they taste like (and we
end up with some gagging noises sometimes!!)..Matter of fact this has
sparked our newest 'idea'..Once every other month we are going to experiment
with different types of foods, I think Japanese will be our first since it's
our 'inspiration'..we're still working out the details but we will either be
attempting to cook a traditional meal or finding a restaurant and
experiencing a traditional meal :grin:..

messages.subject: Re: Jamie Oliver was Why, oh why have the TV? Please passionate advocates of the TV, say something! [AlwaysLearning] TV, Video and unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: HAH, Naked chef is *ok* but IRON CHEF rules all.. We are fully addicted to that show, every once of us races to the tv when it s one so we can guess what new
messages.messageBody:
HAH, Naked chef is *ok* but IRON CHEF rules all..

We are fully addicted to that show, every once of us races to the tv when it's one so we can guess what 'new' ingredient will be unveiled and how the chefs will prepare them..Then we try and fathom what they taste like (and we end up with some gagging noises sometimes!!)..Matter of fact this has sparked our newest 'idea'..Once every other month we are going to experiment with different types of foods, I think Japanese will be our first since it's our 'inspiration'..we're still working out the details but we will either be attempting to cook a traditional meal or finding a restaurant and experiencing a traditional meal :grin:..

<ramble off>

Nichoel

Fertility Friend Online Support Guide
Now you CAN conceive online..
www.fertilityfriend.com/sm/21749/
----- Original Message -----
From: ElissaJC@...
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, January 28, 2002 12:40 PM
Subject: Re: Jamie Oliver was Why, oh why have the TV? Please passionate advocates of the TV, say something! [AlwaysLearning] TV, Video and unschooling


Sharon said:
* A food show about getting prime rib to cook properly and a neat thing to
do with roasted onions at the same time.

Hye! I saw that!! The naked Chef! I love that shoe. He is soooo cool!
My husband was wondering if he was gay. I said, No, He's just British.
Elissa
